items.description: River Arrow and River Alne
items.message:
River levels are forecast to rise at the Henley and Little Alne river gauges as a result of expected heavy rainfall overnight. Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is expected to begin tomorrow morning, 14/10/2024. We expect flooding to affect low-lying land and roads adjacent to the River Arrow between Studley and Salford Priors and the River Alne between Bird in Hand and Alcester on the River Alne including farmland and caravan parks. We are issuing this flood alert as a precautionary measure.
We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are actively checking river levels and the weather forecast.  
Please avoid using low lying footpaths and bridges near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.  
This message will be updated by 11:00 on 14/10/2024, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Upper Bristol Avon area
items.message:
River levels are currently falling but are forecast to rise overnight in response to forecast rainfall.

Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the Bristol Avon, Tetbury Avon, Sherston Avon, Dauntsey Brook, with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected, particularly around low lying areas in Tetbury, Badminton, Brook End at Luckington, Corsham, Lacock and the road at Reybridge.

We are closely monitoring the situation and will issue further Flood Alerts or Warnings if necessary. Drier conditions are expected until early next week and the situation should continue to improve.

Please monitor local water levels and weather conditions and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.

This message will be updated by 2:00 PM on 14/10/2024, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Cherwell from Lower Heyford down to and including Oxford

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Cherwell, Woodeaton Brook, Bayswater Brook, Marston Brook, Peasmoor Brook

items.message:
Property flooding is not currently expected. 
River levels are high but falling on the lower River Cherwell following recent heavy rainfall. Therefore, flooding of low lying land and roads is expected to continue today, 14/10/24 , especially in the Thrupp area. The rain is forecast to clear through Monday morning. Tuesday should be mostly dry but heavy rain is forecast overnight. River levels are expected to remain high over the coming days and remain sensitive to further rainfall.
We are closely monitoring the situation. Avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses. Go to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. This message will be updated by tomorrow morning, 15/10/24 ,or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Windrush from Bourton to Newbridge
items.message:
Property flooding is not currently expected. 
River levels remain high but stable on the River Windrush. Therefore, flooding of low lying land and roads is expected to continue today, 14/10/24 especially in the Bourton on the Water and Newbridge areas. The rain is forecast to clear through Monday morning. Tuesday should be mostly dry but heavy rain is forecast overnight. We expect river levels to remain high for the next few days. River levels remain sensitive to rainfall.
We are monitoring the situation. Avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses. Go to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. This message will be updated tomorrow morning, 15/10/24 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Evenlode from Moreton in Marsh to Cassington and also the River Glyme at Wootton and Woodstock
items.message:
Property flooding is not currently expected. 
River levels are still high on the River Glyme but are falling very slowly. River levels have fallen below the flood risk threshold on the River Evenlode. Therefore, flooding of low lying land and roads is expected to continue today, 14/10/24 , especially in the Woodstock area. The rain is forecast to clear through Monday morning. Tuesday should be mostly dry but heavy rain is forecast overnight. River levels are expected to remain high on the River Glyme for the next few days. River levels remain sensitive to further rainfall.
We are monitoring the situation. Avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses. Go to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. This message will be updated tomorrow morning, 15/10/24 or as the situation changes.

Sunday should be mostly dry with rain forecast overnight into Monday morning. River levels are expected to remain high over the coming days and are sensitive to further rainfall.

items.description: South East Somerset Rivers, Upper Reaches

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Yeo, River Cam, River Wriggle, Barwick Stream, West Coker Stream

items.message:
Water levels are high, but steady, at the Sherborne Lake gauge on the River Yeo. However, river levels are forecast to rise overnight as a result of rainfall this evening.

Flooding may affect locations near the River Yeo, River Cam, River Wriggle, with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected, particularly around the Sparkford to Weston Bampfylde road and Deep Ford Lane, Chetnole. Property flooding is not expected.

The weather is expected to become more unsettled over the next few days. Rain, possibly heavy, is forecast for tonight but clearing through Monday morning.
 
We are monitoring river levels closely. Please avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses. Monitor local water levels and weather conditions.

This message will be updated by 4PM on Monday 14/10/2024, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Lower Avon and tributaries

floodArea.county: Bournemouth, Christchurch and Poole, Dorset Council, Hampshire

items.message:
Rising river levels this morning may lead to flooding.
Flooding of roads and low lying land is possible, property flooding is not expected.
Flooding is possible from 8:23 AM on 14/10/2024.
Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the Middle and Lower Hampshire Avon, with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected, particularly around tributaries between Ringwood and Christchurch.
Further flooding is possible throughout the morning as river levels are rising steadily due to overnightÂ rainfall.
We are monitoring rainfall and river levels.
Start acting on your flood plan if you have one.
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses.
This message will be updated by 10:00 AM on 15/10/2024, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Hundred Foot Washes in Cambridgeshire and Norfolk

floodArea.riverOrSea: Old Bedford River, New Bedford River, Hundred Foot Drain, River Delph

items.message: River levels are falling but remain responsive to further rainfall. This information is correct as of 7:30am on Monday 14 October. There are currently no issues on the Earith causeway. The causeway at Sutton Gault has approximately 12 centimetres of water on the road. The causeway at Welney has approximately 12 centimetres of water on the road. Due to the uneven surface of the roads, water may be deeper in places. The Environment Agency are liaising with Cambridgeshire Highways and Norfolk Highways, who will decide whether to close the roads. For more information about the causeway at Welney, please visit the 'Welney Flood Watch' Facebook group. Please note that the content of this group does not represent the views of the Environment Agency. We will update this message by 4pm today 14/10/2024.

items.description: Lower River Colne and Frays River

floodArea.county: Buckinghamshire, Greater London, Hertfordshire, Hillingdon, Slough, Surrey, Windsor and Maidenhead

items.message:
River levels are high and steady on the Lower River Colne and Frays River today, Sunday 13th October.

No property flooding is expected, but flooding may continue to affect low lying land and roads, particularly in the Thorney Mill Road and Cricketfield Road areas, which may impact Riverside Mobile Home Park.

The forecast shows rain overnight into tomorrow morning, with levels expected to remain high and steady on the Lower Colne at our Staines Moor river gauge. 

We are continuing to monitor rainfall and river levels and will remove this alert when the risk has reduced.

Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses, and monitor local water levels and weather conditions.

This message will be updated by 6pm tomorrow, Monday 14th October, or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: Flagham Brook, Swill Brook, Hankerton Brook, Hykemeres Stream, Derry Brook, River Key

items.description: South Somerset Rivers, Upper Reaches
items.message:
River levels are forecast to rise overnight on the River Isle and River Parrett, as a result of rainfall this evening. Flooding of roads and low lying land is possible. Property flooding is not expected at this time.

Areas most at risk include roads at Ashford Mill, Isle Brewers, Fivehead, the Norton sub Hambdon to Stratton road, the A356 and the B3165 at Chiselborough and the B3168 at Ilford Bridges. The lower River Parrett is forecast to be bankfull and overtopping could occur.

The weather is expected to become more unsettled over the next few days. Rain, possibly heavy, is forecast for tonight but clearing through Monday morning.
 
We are closely monitoring the situation. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses. Refer to local authority website for local road closures. 

This message will be updated by 5PM tomorrow, Monday 14/10/2024, or as the situation changes.

items.description: The tidal Rivers Bure, Ant and Thurne
items.message: This message has been issued because some minor flooding to riverside roads and footpaths is likely today, Sunday 13th October, and for at least the next 24hrs. Water levels continue to remain high, but are expected to soon start to drop back down to more normal levels. We expect to see high water levels around Potter Heigham, Wroxham boat yards and Ferry Road in Horning.  We are not currently expecting the situation to escalate, or to issue any further warning messages at this time. Take care on waterside roads and footpaths, and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. We are monitoring the situation and not expecting the situation to escalate. We will update this message tomorrow morning, Monday 14th October, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Yeo and River Parrett Moors around Muchelney and Thorney
items.message:
The River Yeo level at Huish Episcopi Pumping Station is 7.71 m and steady. The drain level is 6.8 m and falling steadily. Flooding will affect the road from Langport to Muchelney if this drain level exceeds 7.3 m.
 
River levels have fallen but some water remains on the moors, and low lying land and roads may still be under flood water, so this flood alert remains in force.

We continue to pump at Huish Episcopi and Westover pumping stations and are using the Parrett Relief Channel to further reduce river levels. We continue to maximise pumping operations to clear as much water off the moors as possible.

The weather is expected to become more unsettled over the next few days. Rain, possibly heavy, is forecast for tonight, clearing through Monday morning.
 
We continue to monitor the situation closely. Do not attempt to drive, cycle or walk through flood water, and be careful using footpaths near local watercourses and flooded areas. Refer to @TravelSomerset for local road closures.
 
This message will be updated by 4PM tomorrow, Monday 14/10/2024, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Bear Brook and tributaries in the Aylesbury area, including Wendover and Weston Turville
Mid Bristol Avon area

items.message:
Rising river levels overnight may lead to flooding from 6:00 AM on Monday 14/10/2024. No property flooding is currently expected.

Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the Bristol Avon, Semington Brook, with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected, particularly around low lying land and roads between Melksham and Bathford. The flood gates at Holt Road may be closed.

Further rainfall is forecast on Tuesday and Wednesday and river levels are likely to increase further.  We are closely monitoring the situation and checking flood defence assets.

Please avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and refer to local authority website for road closures.

This message will be updated by 2:00 PM on 14/10/2024, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Chew catchment

floodArea.county: Bath and North East Somerset, North Somerset, Somerset
floodArea.riverOrSea: River Chew, Chew Stoke Stream, Winford Brook

items.message:
Rising river levels overnight may lead to flooding. Flooding of roads and low lying land is possible, property flooding is not expected. Flooding is possible when river levels are at their highest from 2:00 AM until around 6:00AM on Monday 14/10/2024.

Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the River Chew, Winford Brook, Chew Stoke Stream, with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected, particularly around the fords on Mill Lane and Pilgrims Way in Chew Stoke and The Batch and Dumpers Lane in Chew Magna.

Further flooding is possible through the week with further rain forecast for Tuesday and Wednesday particularly. We are closely monitoring the situation and will issue Flood Alerts and Warnings as necessary.

Consider activating any property flood protection products and  avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.

This message will be updated by 2:00 PM on 14/10/2024, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Upper River Tamar
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Tamar, River Strat, River Neet, River Ottery, River Kensey

items.message:
Flooding is possible this evening, Sunday the 13th of October and overnight into Monday morning.  Rivers are expected to rise in response to a band of rainfall, heavy at times from early this evening and overnight into Monday.   

Expected river levels suggest that there will be flooding to low lying land and roads close to rivers from around midnight. We expect the Rivers Strat and Neet to respond quickly, peaking in the early hours of Monday morning and the River Tamar to continue to rise, peaking by daybreak. No flooding to properties is currently forecast.     

Take care near the areas of concern and monitor your local weather conditions. There may be standing water present for several days, please do not walk or drive through flood water as it is hazardous. We are monitoring river levels and have staff in the area checking for and clearing blockages.  

This message will be updated by midday on Monday the 14th of September, or earlier if the situation changes.

items.description: West Somerset Streams

floodArea.riverOrSea: Horner Water, River Aller, Washford River, Hawkcombe Stream, Monksilver Stream, Doniford Stream

items.message:
River levels are forecast to rise overnight, as a result of rainfall this evening. Flooding of roads and low lying land is possible. Property flooding is not expected.
Areas most at risk include the Horner Water, Rivers Aller, Washford River and the Hawkcombe, Monksilver and Doniford Streams and tributaries.

The weather is expected to become more unsettled over the next few days. Rain, possibly heavy, is forecast for tonight but clearing through Monday morning.
 
We are closely monitoring the situation. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.

This message will be updated by 5PM tomorrow, Monday 14/10/2024, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Tone catchment

floodArea.riverOrSea: Hillfarrance Brook, Halsewater Stream, River Tone

items.message:
River levels are forecast to rise overnight into early Monday morning, as a result of rainfall this evening.
 
Areas most at risk include roads around Hillfarrance, Bradford on Tone, Lane End Road at Ham and the Creech St Michael to Henlade road. Bradford on Tone ringbanks will be bankfull. Property flooding is not expected.

The weather is expected to become more unsettled over the next few days. Rain, possibly heavy, is forecast for tonight but clearing through Monday morning.
 
We are closely monitoring the situation. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.

This message will be updated by 5PM tomorrow, Monday 14/10/2024, or as the situation changes.

items.description: West Dorset Rivers and Streams

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Asker, River Brit, River Bride, River Char, River Lim

items.message:
Rising river levels overnight may lead to flooding.
Flooding of roads and low lying land is possible, property flooding is not expected.
Flooding is possible when river levels are at their highest from 2:00 AM on 14/10/2024.
Areas most at risk are low lying land and roads near the River Char.
Further flooding is possible overnight as river levels are forecast to rise due to overnightÂ rainfall.
We are monitoring rainfall and river levels.
Start acting on your flood plan if you have one.
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.
This message will be updated by 9:00 AM on 14/10/2024, or as the situation changes.
